value: Plan de l'Ecritoire de Porcelaine [Design for Porcelain Writing Set, Plan, 2nd pl.], pl. 45 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Porcelain writing set in plan consisting of a large shell-like form with two inkwells flanking a large central cartouche, the royal crown and small cartouche below.

label: Physical description
value: Etching on off- white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Ciseaux et Pomme de canne [Design for Scissors and Cane Handle, 3rd Plate], pl. 44 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Consisting of five designs; three pairs of scissors, a cane knob, and a detail of the top of the cane knob. Two scissors are in their cases, which are decorated with delicate floral designs at top and bottom. The cane knob is decorated with bands of foliage and acanthus leaves. The top of the knob shows two female figures and two animals.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Traineau de Jardin fait pour la Reine premiere douairiere d'espagne en 1735, 4th Plate [Garden Sled for Marie-Anne de Neu bourg Queen of Spain], pl. 49 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Side view of a garden sleigh, high-backed seat decorated with bands of foliage, curved sleigh back decorated with acanthus leaves.

label: Physical description
value: Etching on off- white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Table de Cabinet., 6th Plate [Study for a Table], pl. 47 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Study table showing two drawers with bearded grotesque mask at center, lock below. Cabriole legs decorated with cascade of acanthus leaves. Underneath table, a covered three-legged censor jar with dragon handles.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Table d'appartement, 7th Plate [Design for a Table], pl. 48 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Elaborately decorated table with cartouches, garlands of flowers, shells, and leaves intertwining the cabriole legs.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Differents Desseins de Tabatieres, premiere planche [Different Designs for Snuff Boxes], p. 49 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Designs for six shell-shaped snuffboxes, each with different arrangements of flowers and leaves.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Gardes d'Epées d'or pour les presens du marriage du Roy en 1725 [Gilt Sword Handle in Honor of the King's Marriage in 1725], pl. 52 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Left hilt: knob engraved with rays, center putti mask, and flowers. Vertical element with bands of leaves and flowers, grotesque mask at bottom. Right hilt: knob engraved with auricular design, vertical element with acanthus leaf design, hands of leaves at bottom. Upper center: knob engraved with three fleurs-de-lis. Details at right: upper cartouche with three fleurs-de-lis surrounded with leaves and shells. Lower cartouche with leaves and shell motifs.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Differents Desseins de Tabatières, deuxième planche [Different Designs for Snuff Boxes, second plate], pl. 50 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Six rococo designs for snuffboxes. Top center: several figures standing in front of a balustrade, a figure (upper left) sitting next to a fountain; center cartouche: female figure in front of alter showing Solomonic columns, putti abound, central female figure holding reigns of a rearing horse.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Garde d'Epées d'or pour les presens du Marriage du Roy en 1725., troisième planche [Sword Handle in honor of the King's Marriage in 1725, third plate], pl. 51 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurèle Meissonier

label: Description
value: Center sword hilt flanked by three details of pummel, finger grips, and plate on each side, engraved with cartouches decorated in rococo style.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Third state. Portrait bust of J. A. Meissonnier facing three quarters to his right in oval frame on which is written "JUSTUS AURELIUS MEISSONNIER ARCHITECTURAM UNIVERSAM LIBRIS IV TRACTAVIT." The portrait is surrounded by a cartouche consisting of a shell (lower center), a globe (lower left), book (lower right), and acanthus leaves (flanking portrait).

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Differents desseins de Tabatières, et pomme de canne, cinquième planche [Different Designs for Snuff Boxes and a Cane Handle, 5th Plate], pl. 53 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Four designs for snuff boxes. Two large scenic designs, one with figures and sailing ship enclosed in a cartouche, the other showing three figures hauling lumber (?) with church and low buildings in background. Two small cartouches with frolicking putti. The cane handle is decorated with swirling acanthus leaves and flowers.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Boëtes de Montre [Designs for Watch Cases], plate 54 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Six etchings for watch cases showing architectural elements, fountains, mythological figures, putti, flowers and foliage.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Neuvième Livre des Oeuvres de J.A. Meissonnier, Surtout de Table/Cuvette de Roy [Ninth Series of Designs from the work of J.A. Meissonnier, Design for Table Centerpiece/King's Bowl], pl. 55 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Only state. Table centerpiece in full-blown rococo style consisting of a central tureen with a winged angel and putti on top, two pairs of candle branches flanking the tureen, assorted ewers, covered boxes, and shell-shaped bottle holders, flowers and leaves interspersed throughout the arrangement, which is on a stand.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cuvette pour le Roy [Design for the King's Wash Basin], pl. 56 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Basin with central cartouche, surrounded by a shell, showing three fleurs-de-lis and crown, the arms of the king. The cartouche is flanked by putti reaching towards a cascade of laurel leaves.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Terrine, pl. 57 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Covered tureen (and stand) with a swirling shape, foliate knob on cover, stand,resting on C-scrolls, has same flowing, fluid lines as the tureen.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Seau à rafraichir executé pour M. le Duc en 1723 [Wine Cooler made for M. le Duc (Louis-Henri de Bourbon in 1723], pl.. 58 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: 1st state. Wine cooler decorated with mythological figures holding snakes (male to left, female to right), arms of the king at center. In cartouche below, scene of male figure holding a pitchfork in his left hand and two galloping horses.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Sallieres et Tabatières [Salt Dishes and Snuff Boxes], plate 69 in Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Three projects for salt cellars and two snuffboxes. Two open salt cellars:  on left with swirling base, on right with a scalloped base. Center covered salt cellar on legs. Two snuff boxes decorated with acanthus leaves, flowers and branches.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Porte Huillier [Designs for Cruets], pl. 60 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Cruets for oil and vinegar, decorated on cover and around base with grape clusters, acanthus leaves, and oak leaves.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Dixieme livre des oeuvres de J.A. Meissonnier, Surtout de Table/Terrine [Tenth Series of Designs from the work of J.A. Meissonnier, Table Centerpiece/Tureen], pl. 61 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Elaborate table centerpiece consisting of central covered urn decorated with two putti, center shell, four candle arms, and two male/animal figures. The plateau shows a symmetrical arrangement of bowls of fruits, cruets, covered dishes interspersed with flowers.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Tureen, from Dixieme Livre des Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonier, plate 62 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Covered tureen on stand. Cover is dominated by a large crayfish, a snail and oak leaves. The body of the tureen and stand are composed of swirling acanthus leaves and shell motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Etching on off- white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Differents Desseins de Sallieres [Various Designs for Salt Dishes], pl. 63 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier

label: Description
value: Five designs for open salt cellars, each has asymmetrical arrangement with predominantly shell motifs, placed on three levels of platforms.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Nef pour le Roy., Nef aux armes royales, (1728-1729), 4th Plate

label: Description
value: Nef on base decorated with putti and sea creatures, a central cartouche containing the coat of arms of the king.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Covered tureen, knob on lid in shape of a large artichoke with descending leaves. Body of tureen shows central cartouche with royal crown on top. Cascades of flowers flank the cartouche. Tureen has two handles.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Bougeoir Mouchette et Porte Mouchette, Plateau avec bougeoir et paire de mouchettes, (1730-1735), 6th Plate

label: Description
value: Splayed candleholder, spiraling arms decorated with small flowers on wide base with central shell motif. Snuffer is scissor-shaped with bracket element toward tip to snuff wick.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Projet de grand Chandelier à branche pour le Roy., Chandelier à cinq branches avec un dragon, 2nd Plate

label: Description
value: Candelabra with five arms decorated with acanthus leaves, a putto leaning out from the stem, a dragon below, set on a base with a central cartouche.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
CINQUIEME LIVRE D'ORNAMENS Inventés Par J.A. Meissonnier et Gravé par Huquier

label: Description
value: Large cartouche in which "CINQUIEME/LIVRE D'ORNAMENS/Inventés/Par J.A. Meissonnier/et/Gravé par Huquier" is written. The cartouche is decorated with a shell motif on top, dragons descending either side and the sea with two sailing vessels. The horizon and sky are in the background.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Onzieme livre des oeuvre de Mr. Meissonnier/Projet de Chandelier à branche pour le Roy.

label: Description
value: Title page for the eleventh book of the work of Meissonnier. A five-armed candelabra with a putto leaning out from the central branch. The branches are heavily decorated with acanthus leaves. An eagle is perched below on the base.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design of a Fountain in a Grotto and Architectural Elements

label: Description
value: 1st state. Central fountain with river god at left, figures atop a plinth at right. Architectural elements include columns (at left), a temple (upper center), and a church steeple through an opening showing perspective (lower right). Floral and acanthus leaf decoration complete the panel.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Girandolle à branche de porcelaine garnie d'or (Girandolle with Porcelain Branches Covered in Gold), plate 69, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Girandolle (calendabrum) on platform; three entwined branches covered in foliage, ending with two floral sockets.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Girandolle à branche de porcelaine garnie d'or (Girandolle with Porcelain Branches Covered in Gold), plate 70, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Girandolle (calendabrum) on platform; three entwined branches covered in foliage, ending with two floral sockets.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Miroir de Toillette., Mirior de toilette, 5th Plate

label: Description
value: Mirror with cartouche at top center, a crown above, putti figures and delicate leaves decorate both sides of frame, shell motif at bottom center. The mirror stands on two legs.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Côté de l'Ecritoire de Monsieur le Comte de Maurepas., Écritoire pour le comte de Maurepas, 1731, 6th Plate

label: Description
value: Side view of inkstand composed of an arrangement of broad swirling lines.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Dousieme livre des oeuvres de J.A. Meissonnier/Livre de Chandeliers de Sculpture en Argent.

label: Description
value: Candelabra with three branches exuberantly decorated with leaves on candleholders, leaves twisting down the body and terminating with a cascade of leaves and flowers that rest on a base.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design with Steps and Terrace Guarded by Two Sphinxes

label: Description
value: Design composed of a frame of volutes in which steps lead up to a terrace that is guarded by two sphinxes. A large shell motif is flanked by leaves (left) and a tree (right).

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Candlestick, plate 74, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Candlestick on platform; twisted from bottom up with vegetal forms; a crown-like object sits at center.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 31, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Rocaille design with large seashell at center full of foliage.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Candlestick, plate 75, from Cinquième Livre d'Ornemens, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Candlestick on platform; twisting from bottom to top, curves decorate entire body. Some leaves draped at bottom off platform.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Ornament from Cinquieme Livre d'Ornemens, plate 32, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: View of fantastic architecture scene with four nude figures in foreground. Buildings on left, large fountain, all in curved Rococo style.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Candelabrum with Three Arms, plate 76, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: Candlestick on platform; body formed by twisting stem and curled edges, ending in two floral sockets with branches made of curled stems and leaves.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Ornamental Panel, plate 33, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)

label: Description
value: At center of ornamental panel, a putto sits on back of an eagle with wings spread, rays of light as backdrop. Surrounding central figures, curving and curling decorative elements.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
